item.title: Digital root
item.description: Digital root Digital root or digital sum of non-negative integer is the sum of digits in the number. The result is single digit number, for example $$ 256 = 2 + 5 + 6 = 13 = 1 + 3 = 4 $$ Properties of digital root: if we multiply any number by 9, the digital root will be always 9 adding 9 to a number does not change the digital root if we divide any number by 9 the remainder is the digital root $$ 9 \equiv 0(\mod 9) $$
